message:
Guys,

I have two CSV database files with [email, first name, last name]. I want to remove the content of a CSV file from the other one. 

Story: 10K records CSV email database, was tested for bad email, software only exported 900 records that's bad and should be removed from the original database.

Anyone with experience getting this done, even using excel?

Thanks

data.message: I can do it for you in Python
I can do it in C# :)

So much hassle for a very simple problem. If the CSV data in both files are in the same order.
Short_file.csv [email, first_name, last_name]
long_file.csv [email, first_name, last_name]

Then a fast-grep will do the job (Disclaimer, make backup copies first):
grep -Fvf bad_users.csv all_users.csv > users_final.csv

https://gist.github.com/l0gicpath/9185572
Thanks Hady trying to make the grep command work on windows, installed the GnuWin32 but unable to call command, anyway it can work on Windows?
Abdelrahman Magdy it should definitely work without changes. Is the error indicating that it can't find the grep command or it runs but breaks with an error?
You can do it with Google Spreadsheet :)
Thanks Hady I managed to do it easier with Excel by embedding both files, highlighting duplicate records, delete and export. Couldn't get the command to run on my CMD.EXE for some reason.
